intro: Phacelia fallax, commonly known as the slender phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Phacelia fallax is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to attract pollinators and improve soil stability.
